title: dragonb
author: dragonb
content: Hello everyone - lately I'm interested in the crypto market and would like to get in... comments.author: right-as-rain
comments.body: I agree, I guess there will be pretty much as many opinions as people you ask.   It will always be risky investing in something new, but if you’re willing to try your luck you might get rewarded  Personally, I reckon that with climate change and the generally unstable global situation at the moment, it is time for a new approach in cryptocurrencies as well. That is to say, a more democratic, and also more energy efficient way of using Blockchains. Looking at proof of work or proof of stake, there is definitely room for improvement when it comes to fairness and power consumption, but if you took some time to read into the subject of crypto, you will already know that. If not, I’d highly recommend it. As with anywhere else, it makes sense to take a sustainable approach here. So in my opinion, currencies that use the concept of proof of personhood will be the next big thing in the market. At the moment I personally only know of Idena doing that, but hopefully the trend will spread soon.

comments.body: With the exception of shitcoins, the whole market is undervalued in 2022. That is what a bearish market represents. Every altcoins which have a working project concept and showed solid results previously, with loyal supporters' base along the time, are likely to perform well on the next bull run. But keep in mind altcoins by themselves do nothing. It's bitcoin currency which pushes them above. Without bitcoin pumping there isn't altcoins' bull run. So it really doesn't make sense to not pick bitcoin to invest. That is the safest and surest option in crypto market.
